name: CLIMATE LEADERSHIP PROGRAM x Resilient Cities (Bengaluru)~ SUSTERA
description:
<aside> 💡 The Climate Leadership Program X on Resilient Cities is a professionally guided leadership program designed by SUSTERA Foundation to empower dedicated citizen leaders from Bangalore to tackle the city’s unique urban hazard challenges. In this 10-week intensive fellowship, selected few individuals aged 22 to 45 will gain an in-depth understanding of urban climate risks and the skills to address pressing environmental issues that impact Bangalore’s communities daily. 
This fellowship focuses on real, actionable change, equipping participants with tools to tackle urban hazards that threaten the city’s sustainability, including water scarcity, urban heat, flooding, and air pollution. By the end of the program, participants will not only understand the complexities of these issues but also be prepared to lead community-driven initiatives for a resilient and sustainable Bangalore. 
Commitment Requirement: This program requires a commitment of approximately 10 hours per week along with 3 offline days for immersive, hands-on learning. 
Note: This program is designed for those ready to take initiative, build a resilient Bangalore, and lead impactful citizen movements for climate resilience. 
APPLY NOW!  
Registration closes on 10 Dec 2024

Join the conversation to uncover the behind the scenes story of Bangalore International Airport, the first Greenfield Airport in India. This session dives into the commitment towards environment and sustainability and the process to make an airport sustainable.

location.name: Bangalore International Centre, 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071

name: Asian Waterbird Census
description:
The Asian Waterbird Census (AWC) takes place every year. This citizen science event is a part of the global International Waterbird Census (IWC) that supports the conservation and management of wetlands and waterbirds worldwide. 
By using eBird and filling out an additional site form, one can participate in this multi-country effort to document the state of our wetlands and waterbirds. To take part, you simply visit a wetland and count the birds you see there. Join the 2025 Asian Waterbird Census (AWC). Count waterbirds at wetlands, upload to eBird, and fill out a site form to help document wetland and waterbird populations. Details here.

name: Support Circle for Social Organizations
description:
Discover impactful pitches by three social entrepreneurs championing the Circular Economy, connect with changemakers, and explore opportunities to volunteer, intern, or freelance at the ‘Support Circle for Social Organizations’ pitching and discussion event, organized by Terrum at the Samagta Foundation. 
Register here

location.name: Samagata Foundation, 46/1, Cobalt, 4th, Church St, Haridevpur, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India, Bangalore, Karnataka, 560001, India

name: Certified Citizen Naturalist course ~ The Naturalist School
description:
Announcing the Citizen Naturalist course! Our much awaited course is now open for registrations 🙂 
This programme provides citizens with essential knowledge and skills to observe, document, and share information about local biodiversity. Participants will gain hands-on experience in identification, ecological understanding, and conservation practices, enabling them to act as advocates for natural heritage in their communities. 
The course emphasizes practical fieldwork, empowering participants to contribute to citizen science initiatives and environmental stewardship. It’s ideal for those looking to make a meaningful impact while connecting deeply with nature. 
The course is recognised by the MoEF&CC (Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change), under Mission LiFE, with the mission to nudge individual and community action to protect and preserve the environment.
APPLY NOW!

name: ClimatEd Summit: Envisioning New Pathways for Education
description:
The “ClimatEd Summit: Envisioning New Pathways for Education” is an event designed to bring together invested stakeholders to co-create a vision for integrating climate education into the Indian education system. The Summit will take place in Bangalore International Centre. It will create a platform for discussing “Innovative Pedagogical Approaches and Curriculum Implementation of Climate Education.” The summit aims to advance climate education through curriculum development, pedagogical tools, teacher training, and narrative building to instill a systemic approach to understanding and engaging with the climate crisis.
About Climate Educators Network (CEN): The Climate Educators Network (CEN) is a vibrant community united by a shared mission to catalyze change in climate education. Through a diverse range of initiatives, including talks, panel discussions, and workshops, we empower educators with the latest research, innovative strategies, and experiential, place-based pedagogical tools designed to foster agency and engagement among both educators and learners. By connecting seasoned professionals and newcomers alike, CEN facilitates collaboration and supports the design and implementation of impactful climate education, advancing the cause of sustainability, resilience, and environmental stewardship in society. 
Register here

location.name: Bangalore International Centre, 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071

name: Lalbagh Flower Show
description:
Be part of this volunteering activity organised by Saahas in making Lalbagh litter-free during the ‘Lalbagh flower show’. Volunteers will raise awareness and participate in plogging activities to keep the premises clean. Choose from two slots: 10 AM–1 PM or 2 PM–5 PM (arrive 30 minutes early).  
Register here!

location.name: Lalbagh West Gate (metro station gate) or East Gate – Bonsai Park Gate, Bangalore
